intro: Eriosema reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined eriosema, is a South African plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and small, trifoliate leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Eriosema reticulatum is adapted to arid conditions and is typically found in shrubland or woodland habitats. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
